org.knime.core.util

Class PathUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.util.PathUtils

  • public final class PathUtils
extends Object
    Utility function based around the new Path API in Java 7.
    Since:
    5.0
    Author:
    Thorsten Meinl, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Set<PosixFilePermission> RWX_ALL_PERMISSIONS
      Permission set in which everybody has all permissions.

        Parameters:

      • deleteDirectoryIfExists

        public static void deleteDirectoryIfExists(Path startDir,
                                           PathFilter filter)
                                    throws IOException
        Deletes the given directory recursively using a path filter. Note that the directory may still exist afterwards if not all files were removed because of the filter.
        Parameters:
        startDir - start directory that should be deleted
        filter - a path filter
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while deleting the directory

      • createTempDir

        public static Path createTempDir(String prefix)
                          throws IOException
        Creates a temporary directory that is automatically deleted when the JVM shuts down.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix string to be used in generating the file's name
        Returns:
        an abstract pathname denoting a newly-created empty directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if the directory could not be created

      • createTempDir

        public static Path createTempDir(String prefix,
                                 Path dir)
                          throws IOException
        Creates a temporary directory that is automatically deleted when the JVM shuts down.
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix string to be used in generating the file's name
        dir - the directory in which the file is to be created, or null if the default temporary-file directory is to be used
        Returns:
        an abstract pathname denoting a newly-created empty directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if the directory could not be created

      • copyDirectory

        public static void copyDirectory(Path source,
                                 Path destination)
                          throws IOException
        Recursively copied the source directory to the destination directory. The source directory is not copied into the destination but the destination directory has the same contents as the source directory in the end. If the destination directory already exists, the contents are merged with the source taking precedence.
        Parameters:
        source - the source directory
        destination - the destination directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while copying

      • copyDirectory

        public static long copyDirectory(Path source,
                                 Path destination,
                                 PathFilter filter)
                          throws IOException
        Recursively copied the source directory to the destination directory. The source directory is not copied into the destination but the destination directory has the same contents as the source directory in the end. If the destination directory already exists, the contents are merged with the source taking precedence.
        Parameters:
        source - the source directory
        destination - the destination directory
        filter - a filter for files that should be moved
        Returns:
        the number of files (not directories!) that have been copied
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while copying

      • moveDirectory

        public static void moveDirectory(Path source,
                                 Path destination)
                          throws IOException
        Recursively moves the source directory to the destination directory. The source directory is not moved into the destination but the destination directory has the same contents as the source directory in the end. If the destination directory already exists, the contents are merged with the source taking precedence.
        Parameters:
        source - the source directory
        destination - the destination directory
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while copying

      • moveDirectory

        public static long moveDirectory(Path source,
                                 Path destination,
                                 PathFilter filter)
                          throws IOException
        Recursively moves the source directory to the destination directory. The source directory is not moved into the destination but the destination directory has the same contents as the source directory in the end. If the destination directory already exists, the contents are merged with the source taking precedence. A filter can be specified in order to skip certain files for directories while moving. Note that the source directory may still exists afterwards if some files have not been moved because of the filter. Also directories are not moved but only their contents
        Parameters:
        source - the source directory
        destination - the destination directory
        filter - a filter for files that should be moved
        Returns:
        the number of files (not directories!) that have been moved
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while copying

      • countFiles

        public static long countFiles(Path directory,
                              PathFilter filter)
                       throws IOException
        Recursively counts the files (not directories!) in the given directory. Optionally a path filter can be supplied.
        Parameters:
        directory - the starting directory
        filter - a filter for files that should be counted
        Returns:
        the number of files (not directories!)
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while traversing the directory tree
        Since:
        5.1

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(Path directory)
                       throws IOException
        Returns whether the given directory is empty.
        Parameters:
        directory - any directory
        Returns:
        true if the directory is empty, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - if the path is not a directory of if an I/O error occurs

      • chmodRecursively

        public static void chmodRecursively(Path path,
                                    Set<PosixFilePermission> perms)
                             throws IOException
        Recursively sets the permission of the given path.
        Parameters:
        path - any path
        perms - the new permissions
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs while setting the permissions and/or traversing the filesystem

      • resolvePath

        public static Path resolvePath(Path parent,
                               String child)
        This method does the same as Path.resolve(String) except that it handles the case when the child path starts with a separator. Instead of starting from the root again it really appends the child path to the parent. I.e. resolvePath("/foo", "/bar") will result in /foo/bar instead of /bar.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent path
        child - the child path
        Returns:
        the resolved path
